basic_info.name: Frost Giant
basic_info.description: A hulking, powerful humanoid with pale blue skin and eyes as cold as a glacier, the frost giant thrives in the most frigid environments. Clad in thick furs and iron weaponry, it embodies the brutal survival and raiding culture of its kind.
basic_info.location: Arctic, tundra, ice caves, or remote mountain peaks

saving_throws.name: Wis
saving_throws.notes: ($+1$ WIS modifier $+ 3$ PB). Proficient to resist mental effects.

abilities.name: Jotunkin Resilience
abilities.description: The giant has advantage on saving throws against being charmed and frightened.

abilities.name: Cold Absorption
abilities.description: Whenever the giant is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half the cold damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Great Axe attacks or one Great Axe attack and one Rock attack.

actions.name: Great Axe
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Glacial Stomp (Recharge 5–6)
actions.description: The giant stomps the ground, sending a shockwave of freezing earth. Each creature within 15 feet of the giant must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also knocked prone.

combat_&_abilities.tactics: The Frost Giant begins combat by throwing rocks to engage distant targets or to soften up foes. Once in melee, it uses Multiattack, favoring the Great Axe for its combined cold and slashing damage. It saves Glacial Stomp to clear space around itself or to punish grouped enemies, especially after closing distance. It focuses on the largest or most heavily armored targets first, viewing them as the primary threat.

legendary_&_lair.ecology: Frost giants inhabit the coldest reaches of the world, favoring ice caves, remote mountain peaks, and tundra. They are carnivorous, hunting large arctic megafauna like mammoth and occasionally resorting to raiding civilized settlements for livestock and spoils. Their society is rigid and hierarchical, centered around tribal loyalty and obedience to a powerful Jarl.
legendary_&_lair.lore: These brutal giants are descendants of Ymir's chilling breath, believing themselves rightful heirs to the cold northern world. They view the smaller 'warm-blooded' races as weak resources to be exploited, and they often carry out long-standing feuds against fire giants and powerful humanoids who trespass on their ancestral lands.
notes: This giant is an excellent brute or shock trooper but is vulnerable to organized tactics and fire magic.
A suitable combat challenge for a party of four 7th-level adventurers, or two 9th-level adventurers.
